French PM Bayrou will seek vote of confidence on September 8
subhead: French Prime Minister François Bayrou will request the vote in a special session ahead of the autumn budget process. The left-wing La France Insoumise and Socialist Party, and far-right Rassemblement National parties have said they will vote against his minority government.

title: Trump moves to oust Fed Governor over mortgage fraud allegations

US Open: Venus Williams, 45, loses her 1st round; Petra Kvitova and Caroline Garcia retire
subhead: Williams, who made her professional debut in 1994, was the oldest singles player at the tournament since Renee Richards, who was 47, in 1981.

title: French researcher Laurent Vinatier now faces espionage charges in Moscow
subhead: The expert on the post-Soviet region has been held in Russia since June 2024. Sentenced to three years in a penal colony, he now faces up to 20 years in prison.

title: The Sixties in England, through the lens of Tony Ray-Jones
subhead: Tony Ray-Jones, who passed away in 1972 at 31, captured the leisure and relaxation culture of 1960s England. From seaside resorts to fairs and society events, the photographer cast an amused yet gentle gaze on his fellow compatriots, without Martin Parr's biting edge. His work is on display at the Festival Photo La Gacilly in Brittany, through October 5.

title: UK's far right mobilizes around asylum crisis: 'I don't want to pay for them anymore'
subhead: Following a court decision upholding the closure of a hotel housing migrants in Epping Forest, opposition to their presence has shown no sign of waning, as seen on Saturday, August 23, in Horley, southern England.

title: Marcel Gauchet, historian and philosopher: 'Progressivism has locked itself into a denial of uncomfortable realities'
François Truffaut's obsession with Isabelle Adjani
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (2/6). While making a name for herself at the Comédie Française, the young actress became the French filmmaker's obsession, who courted her insistently on the set of 'The Story of Adèle H.' in 1975. She resisted him and made her mark with a performance full of restrained violence.

title: From Brittany to the Alps, French cities restrict holiday homes
subhead: Faced with the challenge of housing the residents of highly touristic or attractive cities, some mayors have decided to ban the construction of new vacation properties.

title: Labubu craze leads to shortages and surge in counterfeits
